required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Single Centre Randomized Study Evaluating The Safety And Tolerability Of GSK233705 In Healthy Volunteers.
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-centre, Randomized, Double-blind Placebo-controlled, Dose-ascending, Cross-over Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacodynamics and Pharmacokinetics of Single Inhaled Doses of GSK233705, Formulated With the Excipient Magnesium Stearate, in Healthy Volunteers

brief_summary.textblock: This study will investigate the safety and tolerability of inhaled doses of GSK233705 with a new formulation.

detailed_description.textblock: A single-centre, randomized, double-blind placebo-controlled, dose-ascending, cross-over study to evaluate the safety, tolerability, pharmacodynamics and pharmacokinetics of single inhaled doses of GSK233705 (50, 100 and 200Âµg), formulated with the excipient magnesium stearate, in healthy volunteers.

primary_outcome.measure: General safety and tolerability endpoints: adverse events, blood pressure, heart rate, 12-lead electrocardiogram (ECG), Holter and Lead II ECG monitoring, lung function (FEV1, FVC) and clinical laboratory safety tests over 24 hours.

secondary_outcome.measure: Plasma and urine concentrations of GSK233705 and derived pharmacokinetic parameters from 0 to 24 hours. Serial Specific airway conductance (sGaw) and Forced Expiratory Volume in 1 second (FEV1) measurements over 24 hours post-dose.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy male subjects 18-55 years old
- Non-Smokers
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any subject with breathing problems.
- High blood pressure and heart abnormalities.
- Any subjects currently taking prescription and non-prescription medications.

link.description: Researchers can use this site to request access to anonymised patient level data and/or supporting documents from clinical studies to conduct further research.
Results for study AC2108380 can be found on the GSK Clinical Study Register.

reference.citation: This study has not been published in the scientific literature.

patient_data.ipd_description: Patient-level data for this study will be made available through www.clinicalstudydatarequest.com following the timelines and process described on this site.
